bibl.title: Despatch from Beverly Y. Payne to Edwin F. Uhl, June 6, 1894
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p: Consulate-General of the United States, Monrovia, Liberia, June 6, 1894.
Mr. Beverly Y. Payne, to the Department of State.
[Account and] returns of the Consular Agent at Elmina, for the quarter ending March 31, 1894.
Consulate-General of the United States, Monrovia, Liberia, June 6, 1894.
Honorable Edwin F. Uhl, Assistant Secretary of State, Washington, D. C.
Sir: I have the honor to transmit herewith, the Account and returns of the Consular Agent at Elmina, for the quarter ending March 31, 1894, as per subjoined list of inclosures.
I have the honor to be Sir: your obedient servant,
Beverly Y. Payne, U.S. Vice Consul.
1. Digest of Invoice Book 2. Arrivals and Departures of American vessels 3. Summary of Business.
